'''Interstate 395''' (abbreviated '''I-395''') is a 67-mile-long north-south [[Interstate Highway]] that begins at [[Interstate 95 in Connecticut|Interstate 95]] in [[East Lyme, Connecticut]] and ends at [[Interstate 90]] in [[Auburn, Massachusetts]], where it becomes [[Interstate 290 (Massachusetts)|Interstate 290]]. The original designation for the freeway was '''Route 52'''. Route 52 was slated to become an extension of Interstate 290 before it received the I-395 designation in 1983.<ref>"State Ordered To Lift Ban on Tandem Trucks." ''Hartford Courant'', June 14, 1983. The article lists "I-290 (formerly Route 52)" as one of the highways the lifting of the ban applies to.</ref>
'''Interstate 395''' (abbreviated '''I-395''') is a 67-mile-long north-south [[Interstate Highway]] that begins at [[Interstate 95 in Connecticut|Interstate 95]] in [[East Lyme, Connecticut]] and ends at [[Interstate 90]] in [[Auburn, Massachusetts]], where it becomes [[Interstate 290 (Massachusetts)|Interstate 290]]. The original designation for the freeway was '''Route 52'''. Route 52 was slated to become an extension of Interstate 290 before it received the I-395 designation in 1983.<ref>"State Ordered To Lift Ban on Tandem Trucks." ''Hartford Courant'', June 14, 1983. The article lists "I-290 (formerly Route 52)" as one of the highways the lifting of the ban applies to.</ref>
